description: Array of values of Jordan function J_k(n) read by antidiagonals (version 1).
references: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 199, #3.
R. Sivaramakrishnan, "The many facets of Euler's totient. II. Generalizations and analogues", Nieuw Arch. Wisk. (4) 8 (1990), no. 2, 169-187.
links: Enrique Pérez Herrero, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: J_k(n) = sum( d divides n, d^k*mu(n/d)) - _Benoit Cloitre_ and Michael Orrison (orrison(AT)math.hmc.edu), Jun 07 2002
maple: J := proc(n,k) local i,p,t1,t2; t1 := n^k; for p from 1 to n do if isprime(p) and n mod p = 0 then t1 := t1*(1-p^(-k)); fi; od; t1; end;
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 28 2001
